<h2>#20 - Return objects to enable chaining of functions</h2> <blockquote><p>2016-01-20 by <a href="https://twitter.com/WakeStudio">@WakeskaterX</a></p></blockquote> <p>When creating functions on an object in Object Oriented Javascript, returning the object in the function will enable you to chain functions together.</p> <p><code></code>`js function Person(name) { this.name = name;</p> <p> this.sayName = function() { console.log(&quot;Hello my name is: &quot;, this.name); return this; };</p> <p> this.changeName = function(name) { this.name = name; return this; }; }</p> <p>var person = new Person(&quot;John&quot;); person.sayName().changeName(&quot;Timmy&quot;).sayName(); <code></code>`</p>
